metadata.synopsis: Following a trail of whispered ADs ('Psst. Over here!' 'Come on, before it's too late!') we find a pale elf, hunched down near some long grass. He insists an intellect devourer (brain monster with legs) is hiding there, trying to cajole you to look and kill it. If you approach the grass, a boar bursts out - it was a distraction while Astarion got behind you. He's on edge, but pleased to have the jump on you. He holds a blade to your throat while demanding you tell him what happened on the ship. After a mind meld (vision where he sees a glimpse of your past) you can convince him that you're both victims and should work together to find an answer. Once he realises you're not a threat his tone changes from threatening to charming.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Hurry, I've got one of those brain things cornered.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion runs toward a patch of tall grass, peering into it

199.speaker: Astarion
199.text: There, in the grass. You can kill it, can't you? Like you killed the others.
199.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~He steps behind the player to offer a clear view and points

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *You're well acquainted with ruses like this. The elf is trying to distract you.*

45.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player approaches the grass cautiously. A shape moves, and then - with a squeel - a boar bursts out and runs off

313.speaker: Narrator
313.text: *Just a dumb boar. You're relieved, until you see the flash of a dagger.*
313.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Player recovers after the shock of seeing the boar, and Astarion is revealed to be creeping up behind them with a dagger.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Put it away. We don't need to fight.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Don't we? I saw you on the ship - free, scuttling about.

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: You're in league with them, aren't you? Those tentacled - argh.
150.context: NodeContext: "those tentacled freaks" interupted by mind meld

256.speaker: Player
256.text: If this is a robbery, you're off to a bad start, friend.

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: I just need information. I saw you scuttling about on the ship.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: One more step and I'll make you eat that knife.

231.speaker: Astarion
231.text: You can try, but first you'll tell me what you know.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: I saw you on the ship. You're in league with them, aren't you? Those tentacled - argh.

181.speaker: Astarion
181.text: Shh. Not a sound. Not if you want to keep that darling neck of yours.

55.context: InternalNodeContext: Checks to see if Avatar is alone or if another companion is present

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: And you - keep your distance. No need for this to get messy.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: No messes? How dull. I'd much rather be dripping with this pretty boy's blood.

358.speaker: Astarion
358.text: You flirt. But I have other business.
358.context: NodeContext: Response to "I'd rather be dripping with this pretty boy's blood". Quite a tense moment, so not too jokey

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: I need them alive - stow that blade or I'll show you just how messy things can get.

297.speaker: Astarion
297.text: Promises, promises. But I have other business, I'm afraid.
297.context: NodeContext: Response to "I'll show you just how messy things can get"

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: I will rip your face off, fancy boy.

309.speaker: Astarion
309.text: And I'll eat your heart, fire girl.

158.speaker: Wyll
158.text: Keep your cool - this one's all bite, no bark. Or is it the other way around?

363.speaker: Astarion
363.text: Answer a few little questions and we won't have to find out.
363.context: NodeContext: Response to "this one's all bark, no bite"

205.speaker: Gale
205.text: Couldn't agree more. But if you use that knife, I will incinerate you.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: And your friend with me? Hardly.
33.context: NodeContext: Response to "use that knife and I'll incinerate you"

296.speaker: Astarion
296.text: Now, I saw you on the ship, didn't I? Nod.
296.context: NodeContext: He's behind you, holding a knife to your throat, talking quietly into your ear

340.speaker: Player
340.text: Nod. If you stay very calm, you might not burn him to death - yet.

262.speaker: Astarion
262.text: And now you're going to tell me exactly what you and those tentacled freaks did to me.

331.speaker: Player
331.text: You're lucky I'm not scared of you, elf. If I was feeling threatened, I wouldn't be able to stop myself from turning you into a pile of ash.

368.speaker: Player
368.text: I can barely walk, barely think. I'm not your foe.

319.speaker: Player
319.text: You have it backwards - they took me prisoner, just like you.

269.speaker: Astarion
269.text: Don't lie to me! I - agh.
269.context: NodeContext: agh! = a grunt of surprise. He's starting to have a vision.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: What in the hells are you talking about?

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: Don't play dumb, you little - agh!
56.context: NodeContext: agh! = a grunt of surprise. He's starting to have a vision.

173.speaker: Narrator
173.text: *Your mind twists. You're looking out of unfamiliar eyes, prowling dark, busy streets.*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *You try to hold the memory, but it fades to the worm. The light. The fear.*

333.speaker: Astarion
333.text: What was that? What's going on?
333.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion's groggy. The knife is still near your throat, but it dips, giving you an opening to do something

228.speaker: Player
228.text: It's the mind flayer's worm - it connected us.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: You're not one of them. They took you, just the same as me.
112.context: NodeContext: Lowers the knife, steps into neutral position

311.speaker: Astarion
311.text: And to think I was ready to decorate the ground with your innards. Apologies.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Apology accepted. I might have done the same were the roles reversed.

279.speaker: Player
279.text: Can't blame you - I was looking forward to seeing yours.

327.speaker: Player
327.text: Glad to see we're all caught up now.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Indeed we are. Please, allow me to introduce myself.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You'd better have more to offer than 'apologies'.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: I'm out of wine and flowers, so I hope an introduction will suffice.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: My name's Astarion. I was in Baldur's Gate when those beasts snatched me.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I'm in quite the state, but I think I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

113.speaker: Player
113.text: All you need to know, is you'd better watch your back around me.

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: So do you know anything about these worms?

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Tell him of your crash, your worm, and your ruined brain.

347.speaker: Astarion
347.text: So, did you learn anything about these worms while wandering the ship?

301.speaker: Player
301.text: Tell him your name and your story.

338.speaker: Astarion
338.text: The strong and silent type? All right.

115.speaker: Astarion
115.text: Please tell me you at least know something about these worms.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Yes, unfortunately. They'll turn us into mind flayers.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: Of course it'll turn me into a monster. What else did I expect?

213.speaker: Astarion
213.text: Although it hasn't happened yet. If we can find an expert - someone that can control these things - there might still be time.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Control it? We need to get rid of it.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: You should travel with me. Our odds are better together.

211.speaker: Astarion
211.text: Forgive me, but are you really in a position to invite people along?

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: But if the leader of your little band wants to talk, I'd be happy to hear it.

353.speaker: Astarion
353.text: Well obviously I would, but you have so many followers already. I don't want to crowd you.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: All right. Meet me at camp.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: Gale could do with a rest.

203.speaker: Narrator
203.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

109.speaker: Jaheira
109.text: Well. I know when I'm not wanted.
109.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

133.speaker: Karlach
133.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

201.speaker: Minsc
201.text: Let us lay down a while, Boo. Do not think I have missed your cantenkery today.

316.speaker: Shadowheart
316.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: Excellent - we're a cosy little team now. So, lead on.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: You can trade places with Wyll.

234.speaker: Wyll
234.text: All right. I know a shortcut.

108.speaker: Halsin
108.text: I shall be waiting. Come find me when you need me.

329.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
329.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

288.speaker: Astarion
288.text: All right, but don't keep me waiting, darling.

225.speaker: Astarion
225.text: Tempting, but your party seems a little crowded right now. I like to have my space.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You're welcome at my camp, then.

345.speaker: Astarion
345.text: I was ready to go this alone, but maybe sticking with the herd isn't a bad idea. Safety in numbers, after all.

364.speaker: Astarion
364.text: And I hate to turn down an invitation. All right, maybe I'll see you there.

350.speaker: Narrator
350.text: *As he leaves, you're flooded with visions of a perfect pretty corpse.*

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: You know, I was ready to go this alone, but maybe sticking with the herd isn't such a bad idea.

204.speaker: Astarion
204.text: And anyone that can crash a mind flayer ship and walk away seems like a good person to know.

220.speaker: Astarion
220.text: All right, I accept. Lead on.

240.speaker: Narrator
240.text: *As he joins your side, your mind dances with thoughts of a perfect pretty corpse.*

223.speaker: Astarion
223.text: And you seem like a useful person to know.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I need to get moving, but you can shelter at my camp.

365.speaker: Player
365.text: I've wasted enough time here. Farewell.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: Wait, that's it? 'You're doomed, sorry', and then off to the next adventure?

324.speaker: Astarion
324.text: These worms are doing something - I can feel it. What are you going to do about it?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I'm hunting for a healer. You should do the same.

314.speaker: Astarion
314.text: I need to find out more before I let anyone root around in my skull. I'll find an expert.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: Good luck, I suppose. Here's hoping we're still wearing the same skins when we next meet.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I'll figure out my problems, you figure out yours.

244.speaker: Astarion
244.text: Of course. I'll make my own way.

322.speaker: Astarion
322.text: Well, maybe I'll see you again. Still wearing the same skin, I hope.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Ask the boar. Maybe he has your answer.

290.speaker: Player
290.text: I'm not sure yet. Get drunk? Laugh at you? There are plenty of options.

343.speaker: Player
343.text: I know we don't want them in our heads.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: No, of that much we can be certain.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: You know as much as I do.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: I suppose it's not exactly common knowledge.

264.speaker: Astarion
264.text: These worms are already affecting me. I can feel it. Now what to do about it...

278.speaker: Astarion
278.text: Well, getting out of here, for a start.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: Then finding anyone who might know about these worms. I need an expert. Someone who knows how to control these things...

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Control them? I want them gone.

200.speaker: Astarion
200.text: Well yes, of course. But first things first.

342.speaker: Player
342.text: And I need company for the road. Why not come with me?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I need to get moving, but you can shelter at my camp.

332.speaker: Astarion
332.text: And you. If we meet again, I hope we're still wearing the right skins.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: We can start by travelling together? Better odds, I'd say.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Do what you want. I'm leaving.

356.speaker: Astarion
356.text: No words of wisdom before you go?

291.speaker: Player
291.text: Put the knife away and we can figure it out.

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: How about I keep the knife and you tell me what you know anyway?

189.speaker: Astarion
189.text: I saw into your mind. They took you, just the same as me.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: A fine effort, but I've seen it all. I was walking this land while your ancestors were learning to crawl.
27.context: NodeContext: Player is too weak, Astarion reasserts his grip [JLatino: not for EA]

233.speaker: Astarion
233.text: Now, tell me what just happened! What was that?

330.speaker: Player
330.text: We have mind flayer worms in our heads - they connected us.

303.speaker: Astarion
303.text: Yes. Yes, that has to be it.

280.speaker: Player
280.text: We can talk when you stop acting like a paranoid lunatic.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: Stupid. I saw into your head, you know.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: It sounds like you saw a glimpse of my past. And I saw yours.

302.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion lets the player up and they stand facing eachother

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: You're not one of them. They took you, same as they took me.

295.speaker: Astarion
295.text: I'm half tempted to spill your guts all over the dirt anyway, but for now - apologies.

321.speaker: Astarion
321.text: A fine effort, but I've seen it all. I was walking this land while your ancestors were learning to crawl.
321.context: NodeContext: Player is too slow, Astarion reasserts his grip

359.speaker: Player
359.text: Exploit the distraction and break his hold.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Whisper a cantrip to burn his hand.

362.speaker: Astarion
362.context: NodeContext: [JLatino: Not for EA] Astarion burns his hand, dropping the knife

178.speaker: Astarion
178.text: A fine effort, but I've seen it all. I was walking this land while your ancestors were learning to crawl.
178.context: NodeContext: Astarion flinches at the spell, but holds you tight [JLatino: not for EA]

272.speaker: Player
272.text: Whisper a cantrip to burn his hand.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Whisper a cantrip to burn his hand.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Let me go and I might tell you.

299.speaker: Astarion
299.text: I'm not here for games, you little - agh!
299.context: NodeContext: agh! = a grunt of surprise. He's starting to have a vision.

226.speaker: Astarion
226.context: NodeContext: [JLatino: Not shown for EA] Player headbuts Astarion, but he keeps his grip on them. agh! = a grunt of surprise. He's starting to have a vision.

187.speaker: Astarion
187.context: NodeContext: [JLatino: Not for EA] Player headbutts you, freeing themselves from your grip. Line cut off because he's starting to have a vision.

221.speaker: Narrator
221.text: *Your mind twists. You're looking out of unfamiliar eyes, prowling dark, busy streets.*

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *You try to hold the memory, but it fades to the worm. The light. The fear.*

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: What was that? What's going on?
25.context: NodeContext: Slightly disoriented. You've just had a vision.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: It's the mind flayer's worm - it connected us.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: The worm, of course. That explains things. Somewhat.
84.context: NodeContext: 'Somewhat'. This is still a bizare, insane situation

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I don't know, but something just connected us.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: It's those tentacled monsters. Whatever they did to us caused that link.

162.speaker: Astarion
162.text: It's those tentacled monsters. Whatever they did - whatever they put in us - just created a connection.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: Put the knife away and I'll tell you everything.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: I'm not an idiot. It has to be those tentacled monsters. Something they did...

172.speaker: Astarion
172.text: They took you too. I saw it during... whatever just happened.
172.context: NodeContext: 'whatever just happened' = the vision he just saw.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: Kill it yourself - you look capable enough.

155.speaker: Astarion
155.text: I was so hoping for a kind soul. Well, not to worry.

202.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion, trips the player, pulls a knife and slides it under the player's throat

161.speaker: Player
161.text: If you stay very calm, you might not burn him to death - yet. Stay calm and stand up.

101.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player rolls out of the way and back to their feet

148.speaker: Astarion
148.text: I saw you on the ship, strutting about while I was trapped in that pod.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: What did you and those tentacled freaks do to me?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You're incredibly lucky I'm staying calm enough not to burn you to a crisp. Put the knife away. Now.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: You have it backwards - they snatched me up too.

255.speaker: Astarion
255.text: I'm not an idiot. I saw - argh.
255.context: NodeContext: "I saw you walking free" cut off by mind meld.

334.speaker: Player
334.text: Put the knife away and maybe we can talk.

242.speaker: Astarion
242.context: NodeContext: "I can promise you that." cut off by a mind meld.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I haven't done anything to you. Yet.

182.speaker: Astarion
182.context: NodeContext: "You arrogant little shit" cut off by mind meld.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: Shh, not a word. Let's try to keep that lovely neck of yours in one piece, hmm?

252.speaker: Player
252.text: The elf's grapple is weak, basic. Slip the hold.

163.speaker: Astarion
163.text: All right, we'll do this the old-fashioned way.

306.speaker: Player
306.text: We don't need to deal in deception. What do you really want?

191.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion reacts to line 'we don't need to deal in deception.'

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: First you kill me, then you bring me back? You make quite the first impression.

243.speaker: Astarion
243.text: How about we try words instead of blades? It's safer for everyone.

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: You again? I hope we won't repeat the previous unpleasantness.
85.context: NodeContext: Last time you saw the player they attacked you.

114.speaker: Astarion
114.text: I - I died. They killed me!

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: At least someone had the good grace to bring me back. I suppose that merits an introduction.

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: Well hello. It's nice to see some people are willing to talk, rather than attacking you on sight.
126.context: NodeContext: A different player attacked Astarion before you came along.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: It seems we were both passengers on that damned ship. I suppose that merits an introduction, if nothing else.

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: My name's Astarion. I was in Baldur's Gate when they snatched me and put that thing in my head.

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: Hello again. Still alive, I see.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: As are you. Perhaps we should travel together.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You should come to my camp. It's safer.

169.speaker: Astarion
169.text: First you kill me, then you bring me back? What do you want, exactly?

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You should travel with me. Our odds are better together.

308.speaker: Astarion
308.text: They - they killed me! At least you had the good grace to bring me back.
